entry.title: walked on walls (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Apollo astronauts walked on walls (pictured) before walking on the Moon?

entry.title: Finn Butcher (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Finn Butcher is the inaugural Olympic champion in men's kayak cross?

entry.title: Barry Burton (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Barry Burton's lines such as "You were almost a Jill Sandwich!" from the first Resident Evil game were popular enough to be referenced in following games?

entry.title: Meghri (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that locally endangered Eurasian otters along the river Meghri have become a nuisance to local fish farmers?

entry.title: Minna Stess (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the parents of Olympian Minna Stess built a concrete skatepark in their backyard for their children?

entry.title: causing activists to protest against overtourism (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that wealth generated by tourism in Barcelona is claimed to be a reason for increased social inequality, causing activists to protest against overtourism?

entry.title: Ada Korkhin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Olympic sport shooter Ada Korkhin practiced in her family's apartment, shooting from the kitchen through the living and dining rooms?

entry.title: Alien Blue (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Alien Blue was the most popular Reddit app for iPhone and iPad at the time of its discontinuation?

entry.title: Jay Horwitz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that New York Mets executive Jay Horwitz did not publicly reveal that he had a glass eye until he was in his 70s?
